sense.name: write or create music or text
sense.examples: In 1983, he composed the score for HBO's first film. Tolkien composed the poem in either the late 1920s or the early 1930s. They compose poetry, journal entries, letters, rants, love stories, wish lists, artwork, comic strips... To subscribe to this mailing list, you will need to compose a short email.

sense.name: form the substance of
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[attribute[plural]] COMPOSE NP2[topic] NP1[topic] COMPOSE NP2[attribute[plural]]
sense.examples: Shingle stones and diluvial accumulations compose the greater portion of these plains. CMS and Criticom International compose the largest wholesale monitoring company in the United States. It was composed of representatives from all the unions in the city.

sense.name: create from components
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] COMPOSE NP2[product] PP{FROM NP[source]}
sense.examples: The need to compose product offerings from other products and components is becoming important. They composed the dish out of the box's contents.

sense.name: calm (oneself)
sense.examples: He said he was very impressed with how she got up and composed herself. It is important to compose yourself before stating your case.
